Chat.en: Punk Zombie's piercings represent his individuality and his belief in personal freedom, or maybe just that he fell face-first into a sewing machine.
Chat.zh: 朋克僵尸身上的穿孔代表了他的个性和对个人自由的信仰，或许也只是因为他一头栽进了缝纫机里。

Introduction.en: Trails glamorous rainbows that protect zombies behind her when she's feeling the beat.
Introduction.zh: 感受到属于她的节奏时，映射出彩虹保护身后的僵尸。。

DESCRIPTION.en: crushes plants with her wheels during her jam
DESCRIPTION.zh: 在属于她的音乐下，用滑轮碾压植物

Chat.en: Glitter Zombie inspires zombies everywhere to boogie their brains out, whether it's just one moment or maybe forever, or at least until the lights come on and they're kicking everybody out.
Chat.zh: 闪耀僵尸激励世界各地的僵尸们尽情狂欢，不管是一瞬间还是永远，或者至少是在灯光亮起，在清扫工把他们都赶走之前。

Introduction.en: Spins microphone to damage nearby plants when he's dropping his sick, sick rhymes.
Introduction.zh: 尽情说唱时，顺便甩动麦克风攻击周围的植物。

DESCRIPTION.en: destroys plants in a 3x3 area
DESCRIPTION.zh: 摧毁周围 3x3 范围的植物

Chat.en: MC Zom-B doesn't want you to know it, but his fancy bling is really just gold-plated zinc he got from his grandma.
Chat.zh: 麦克说唱家并不想让你知道，他那华丽的金饰其实只是他从奶奶那里得到的镀金锌。

Introduction.en: Kicks zombies forward when transported by the power of rap.
Introduction.zh: 说唱声带来的带感节奏，使他精力充沛地把僵尸往前推进。

Chat.en: Delivers only the freshest moves at bargain basement prices.
Chat.zh: 只以低的代价展现最新鲜的动作。

Introduction.en: Enters pushing an arcade cabinet.
Introduction.zh: 将一台游戏机推入场内。

DESCRIPTION.en: crushes plants with arcade machine
DESCRIPTION.zh: 用游戏机碾压植物

DESCRIPTION.en: cabinet spits out 8-Bit Zombies during its theme
DESCRIPTION.zh: 在像素的滴答声中，像素僵尸会从游戏机中跳出

Chat.en: When it's a choice between quarters for games and quarters for laundry, Arcade Zombie is prepared to make the ultimate stinky sacrifice.
Chat.zh: 在游戏硬币和洗衣硬币之间做出选择时，街机僵尸准备做出最恶臭的牺牲。

Introduction.en: Pixelated zombie generated by super cool arcade machine. Comes in regular, cone, and bucket flavors.
Introduction.zh: 由超酷街机生成的像素僵尸，普通、路障和铁桶都有。

Chat.en: Being made out of light and positional co-ordinates has no effect on this erzatz zombie's ravenous hunger for tangy brains.
Chat.zh: 把僵尸变成光和像素并不能影响他对美味大脑的贪婪渴求。

Introduction.en: Holds aloft a boom box that tranquilizes all plants with its heartfelt tunes.
Introduction.zh: 高举着音箱，用美妙的曲调安抚所有植物。

DESCRIPTION.en: boombox has no effect on ground plants and Phat Beets
DESCRIPTION.zh: 音箱对地下植物和魔音甜菜无效

Chat.en: Boombox Zombie doesn't want to buy, sell or process anything; he just really wants to consume your brains.
Chat.zh: 音箱僵尸不想买卖或编写任何音乐，他只想消化你的大脑。

Introduction.en: Tossed past most of your defenses, then rocks out to your detriment.
Introduction.zh: 被丢出越过你的大部分防线，然后再摇滚前行。

Chat.en: Impunk's lyrics have been described as "banal", "incoherent," and "totally expressive of the Zompunk movement at its finest."
Chat.zh: 朋克小鬼的音乐风格被形容为 “平庸”、“语无伦次”，“完全表现了‘僵尸朋克’动作的精髓”。

Introduction.en: Dominating leviathan of power-rocking mayhem.
Introduction.zh: 震撼人心的力量型巨尸。

DESCRIPTION.en: crushes plants with guitar
DESCRIPTION.zh: 用电吉他摧毁植物

DESCRIPTION.en: bashes sonic blast when metal music plays
DESCRIPTION.zh: 当重金属音乐响起时，砸出震耳欲聋的音波

DESCRIPTION.en: launches Impunk when damaged
DESCRIPTION.zh: 受重伤时丢出朋克小鬼

Chat.en: Hair Metal Gargantuar only knows one chord, but you'd better believe he'll play it all night and then some.
Chat.zh: 重金属巨尸只懂和弦，但你最好相信他会弹吉他，否则他要弹上一整晚甚至更久。

Introduction.en: An intimate evening with some of Dr. Zomboss' most recent and painful explorations.
Introduction.zh: 与僵尸博士一起狂欢一晚吧，度过这场惊险旅行的休息时光。

DESCRIPTION.en: speakers do passive damage (except to ground plants and Phat Beet) and send out shockwave attacks
DESCRIPTION.zh: 音响对近前的植物（除了地下植物和魔音甜菜）造成伤害，也会发射音波

Chat.en: In another world, in another time, Dr. Zomboss would receive the bounty of enthusiastic applause that is his due. Not here and now, though. Nope.
Chat.zh: 在另一个世界，另一个时空，僵尸博士本应收获如潮掌声——那是他应得的礼赞。可惜此时此刻，此地此景，并没有。

Introduction.en: Regular beard-having zombie from the unimaginable past.
Introduction.zh: 普通的留着胡须，来自远古的僵尸。

Chat.en: Jurassic Zombie is NOT primitive. See, he's wearing a tie and everything!
Chat.zh: 侏罗纪僵尸并不原始。看，他还打着领带呢！

Introduction.en: Cones, or old leftover horns bundled together with string so that they look sort of like a cone, provide some middling protection.
Introduction.zh: 他那由被恐龙砸断的角捆起来做成的路障提供了不错的保护。

Chat.en: Jurassic Conehead Zombie is trying to get the jump on the whole "traffic cone" idea. He figures it'll be a HUGE market in about 150 million years.
Chat.zh: 侏罗纪路障僵尸试图抢占整个“路障”这一概念的先例。他认为，大约 1.5 亿年后，这将形成一个巨大的贸易。

Introduction.en: Crude drawings of buckets provide as much protection as the real thing.
Introduction.zh: 粗略涂画出的铁桶图案使他极其抗揍。

Chat.en: The real question, the burning mystery, is: where did he find blue fur for his outfit?
Chat.zh: 真正的问题是：他从哪里找到蓝色的皮毛做衣服的？

Introduction.en: Fossil skulls not only provide a huge amount of damage absorption, but are also extremely classy.
Introduction.zh: 头骨化石不仅能吸收大量伤害，而且提高了他的档次。

Chat.en: Contrary to his name, Jurassic Fossilhead's fossil head isn't actually a fossil. That skull's maybe a week and a half old, tops.
Chat.zh: 与他的名字相反，侏罗纪龙骨头僵尸的化石头实际上并不是化石，那个头骨最多只有一周半的历史。

Introduction.en: Amberhead Zombie's head-engulfing ball of amber provides hardened protection.
Introduction.zh: 琥珀头僵尸那包裹着头部的琥珀球提供坚硬的保护。

Chat.en: If you were to extract DNA from the Amberhead Zombie and combine it with the DNA of a frog, you'd be breaking the law at some point.
Chat.zh: 如果你从琥珀头僵尸身上提取 DNA 并与青蛙的 DNA 相结合，你在某种程度上会改变整个时间线。

Introduction.en: Marks the arrival of a huge epochal "wave" of highly anachronistic zombies.
Introduction.zh: 预示着一大波老土过时的僵尸的到来。

Chat.en: He's not only got a flag, but he's also got a can-do attitude and a fierce hunger for success. Success and brains.
Chat.zh: 他不仅拥有着一面旗帜，而且有一种敢作敢为的态度和对成功的强烈渴望，成功和头脑。

Introduction.en: Jurassic Rally Zombie marks the arrival of large group of zombies.
Introduction.zh: 侏罗纪大动员僵尸的出现代表了一大群僵尸的到来。

Chat.en: Where did Jurassic Rally Zombie get his fancy new flag? Nobody knows. It's a mystery. The police should look into it. Or maybe we could get a fund together and hire a detective. It's a real puzzle.
Chat.zh: 侏罗纪大动员僵尸从哪儿弄来的新旗帜？没人知道，这是个谜。警方应该调查一下，或者我们可以集资雇个侦探，这真是让人摸不着头脑。

Introduction.en: A trudging, damage-resistant zombie who is immune to Primal Peashooter's knockback.
Introduction.zh: 一个蹒跚而行，却很抗打的僵尸，可免疫原始豌豆射手的击退效果。

DESCRIPTION.en: immune to Primal Peashooter's knockback
DESCRIPTION.zh: 免疫原始豌豆射手的击退

Chat.en: Jurassic Bully is slow, stupid, and smells bad. But hey, at least he's punctual.
Chat.zh: 侏罗纪野人僵尸又慢又笨，还臭得要命。不过，至少他很守时。

Introduction.en: Jurassic Rockpuncher pummels plants with rocks tied to his hands.
Introduction.zh: 侏罗纪打火石野人用绑在手上的石头猛击植物。

DESCRIPTION.en: crushes plants with rocks tied to his hands
DESCRIPTION.zh: 用绑在手上的打火石砸击植物

DESCRIPTION.en: immune to Primal Peashooter's knockback
DESCRIPTION.zh: 免疫原始豌豆射手的击退

Chat.en: Somebody tied rocks to Jurassic Rockpuncher's hands. Being unable to remove them (because he had rocks tied to his hands), he was left with no choice but to roll with it.
Chat.zh: 有人把石头绑在了侏罗纪野人的手上。由于无法取下这些石头（因为他的手上绑着石头），他别无选择，只能拎着石头到处跑。

Introduction.en: A weaker, smaller, much more vicious version of the typical Jurassic zombie.
Introduction.zh: 他相对一般的侏罗纪僵尸体型更弱、更小、更凶残。

Chat.en: This nasty little nipper can make a serious dent in your defenses if left to his own devious devices.
Chat.zh: 如果任由这个讨厌的小东西胡作非为，他会严重破坏你的防御系统。

Introduction.en: Prehistoric provider of Mesozoic malarkey.
Introduction.zh: 创造了史前中生代的传说。

DESCRIPTION.en: crushes plants with bone
DESCRIPTION.zh: 用骨头摧毁植物

DESCRIPTION.en: launches Jurassic Imp when damaged
DESCRIPTION.zh: 受重伤时丢出侏罗纪小鬼

Chat.en: Jurassic Gargantuar wonders how there can be zombies millions of years before the advent of humanity. He doesn't let it get in the way of his plant-bashing, though.
Chat.zh: 侏罗纪巨尸很好奇在人类出现之前的几百万年，怎么会有僵尸。不过，他并没有因此而影响对植物的砸击的力度。

Introduction.en: A mechanical means of dinosaurian destruction.
Introduction.zh: 摧毁你前院的远古时期最凶狠的机械恶兽。

DESCRIPTION.en: summons zombies and dinosaurs
DESCRIPTION.zh: 召唤僵尸时同时召唤恐龙

Chat.en: With flagrant disregard for temporal tidiness and simple good taste, Dr. Zomboss figured it would be a good idea to build a big metal dinosaur.
Chat.zh: 由于自身对时空秩序的蔑视与对基本审美的不屑，僵尸博士认为造个巨型金属恐龙是个绝妙的主意。
